mess.name: Tripping Hazard
mess.description:
It looks like one of the maids found a very nice set of climbing gear in Lord Borkus's sporting equipment. Unfortunately, they apparently decided that the best way to use that equipment involved spreading it all over the stairs. A long rope has been threaded between the banisters on the stairway. Several pitons have been strewn about on the stairs themselves, and a harness is half-hidden under the carpet. Strips of duct tape can be seen holding various knots together.
Assassin: I can still get up the stairs through all this, but it's not going to be easy. Trying to untie all of this will take a lot of time, though.

action.name: Clean
action.description: After fumbling around for far too long, you eventually resort to stabbing the ropes repeatedly with a piton. After several more minutes of struggling, you manage to hack through all the ropes and collect the rest of the climbing equipment. Unfortunately, without the rope, the rest of the climbing gear is pretty much useless.

action.name: Clean
action.description: You hack away at the ropes with a butter knife, and eventually manage to clear away the potential tripwires. It only takes a few more minutes to collect the remaining pieces of climbing equipment, but without the rope, it's pretty much useless.

condition.description: You use the pruning shears to cut the ropes and quickly clear away the potential tripwires. It only takes a few more minutes to collect the remaining pieces of climbing equipment, but without the rope, it's pretty much useless.

action.name: Clean
action.description: You start to read "Fear Knot: A Sailor's Guide to Rope Tricks" and discover that the maid used literally the first rope trick in the book to vandalize the stairwell. With this information in mind, you quickly locate each knot, untangle the rope, and collect the rest of the climbing equipment.
